post_text: International Literacy Day takes place on September 8th every year to raise awareness and concern for literacy problems that exist within our own local communities and globally. This day is not just a reminder to us at FTCSC to read daily in your home with your children, but to also actively find ways to help our community and our world. According to the World Literacy Foundation, 1 out of 5 people in the world cannot Read or Write. There are many ways to help support literacy, for example ask your child's teacher what types of books you could donate to build your child's classroom library or find an organization that you can support that will provide books to students worldwide. #InternationalLiteracyDay #WeAreFlashes‚ö°Ô∏è

post_text: In this edition of the Franklin Flash we celebrate our Child Nutrition Department. Dear FTCSC Families,
Franklin Township Community School Corporation is committed to the health and safety of our students. To prevent the spread of illness we follow recommendations by the Indiana State Department of Health and the Centers for Disease Control. Recommendations include proper hand washing techniques, covering coughs and sneezes, and not coming to school when you are sick. Students and staff are encouraged to stay home and not come to school if they are exhibiting signs and symptoms of illness. Students and staff members should stay home if they have exhibited the following symptoms in the last twenty-four hours: a fever of 100 degrees or higher, vomiting or diarrhea more than once, cough/runny nose that is accompanied by a fever, or a rash that is accompanied by a fever and/or spreading. If an outbreak of an illness were discovered, FTCSC would follow the direction of the local and/or national health departments.

The state of Indiana has released the immunization requirements for the 2020-2021 school year. Please make note of the updated requirements and recommendations for ALL grade levels:

Hepatitis A is a two-part series that requires 6 months in between doses. This immunization series will be required for all students in grades Pre-K through 12th grade for the 2020-2021 school year.

6th grade students are required to have the additional immunizations of 1 Tdap and 1 MCV (Meningococcal) prior to the start of the school year.

Students entering the 12th grade are required to have an additional dose of the Meningococcal immunization-to equal two doses-prior to the start of school

Sincerely,

Franklin Township Community School Corporation Administration
